span.a: You are currently on this page - Home
Free and Reduced Application to Print

p.em: Best viewed in the CHROME browser.

p.span: Wonewoc-Center provides our students with the tools and knowledge to be proud and productive today.
Wonewoc-Center School District envisions a positive culture and inspires community pride by being a safe, financially sustainable and innovative district.
Motto: Lead, achieve and believe.

The District would like to thank all the residents who participated in the Spring Election. Voters approved both questions: Question I - Facilities Repairs & Upgrades - $4,560,000 and Question II – Operational Expenses - $195,000.

We would also like to thank all the community members who participated in the Facilities Planning process that led us to this referendum. The plan was driven by our community and we are excited to bring this plan to life.

Sign-up for lunch and breakfast to be delivered by Wonewoc-Center Schools. This service is free for kids 18 and under! We are asking that when you sign up it will be for all the days. Please call Ms. Gehri at 464-3165 ext. 125.
Menu:

div.h4: Virtual Art Show for students in 4K-12th Grades

p.span: Join us for a Virtual Art Show on Tuesday, April 21st on the Wonewoc-Center Facebook Page!

Students: If you would like to participate in the Virtual Art Show, please have a photo of your artwork ready to share by Friday, April 17th. Get creative; whether it is a new piece or a favorite project you have already completed, we would love to display it!

On Friday, April 17, we will open the show for everyone to post his or her artwork on the W-C Facebook Page. At that time, simply upload a photo of your artwork in the comments section to share with the community. Then on Tuesday, April 21st at 7:00 p.m. we will have the Virtual Art Show!
We cannot wait to see what you have created!

Ms. A. Sherwood, the District therapist from Gundersen St. Joseph's Hospital and Clinics, has created a resource addressing mental health during COVID-19. Click the Resource Guide below for more details and keep yourselves healthy during this time of uncertainty.
Mrs. Chipman will be adding some useful and fun links to the library webpage.
Right now she has posted some sites on the Library/Media Center under the
Cool Sites to Check Out link.
Check them out!

Mrs. Savage, School Counselor, will continue to be available to students for social/emotional, academic, and career needs during Home Learning days. She will be available by email (savakel@wc.k12.wi.us) Monday-Friday to answer questions or provide support. Also, phone calls through Google Hangouts may be available. Please email Mrs. Savage first to set up a time.

A 24 hour chat line for people who are going through a hard time, need to talk, or is thinking of suicide is available at https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/chat/ or 1-800-273-8255. If you have any immediate safety concerns, please call 911.

Wisconsin State Testing has been canceled for the 2019-2020 school year. On March 26, 2020, the Department of Public Instruction officially announced that all state testing will be canceled for the 2019-2020 school year.
The following exams have been canceled:

li.span: Wisconsin Forward Exam for grades 3-8 and Science for grade 10.

p.span: Students taking AP courses will take their exams online, details still being completed and will be announced at a later date.
PLEASE BE SAFER AT HOME! We want to get back to school as we miss our students and staff.

span.span: It is the intent of the Wonewoc-Center School District that the information on its website be accessible to individuals with disabilities in compliance with the requirements of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and its implementing regulations at 34 C.F.R. Part 104, and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 and its implementing regulations at 28 C.F.R. Part 35.
If you have difficulty accessing information on the District’s website due to a disability, please contact us at

and provide the URL (web address) of the material you tried to access, the problem you experienced and your contact information, including your name, email address and phone number, so that we can contact you and accommodate your needs.

Grievances can be filed with the District using the procedures established by the Wonewoc-Center School District Board of Education as outlined in policy 2260.01 (Section 504/ADA prohibition against discrimination based on disability). For more information or to obtain forms contact Dr. Ennis; ennisha@wc.k12.wi.us;
